node.title: WA residents forced to isolate because of COVID to get cash payments amid renewed health spend
node.alt: A queue of people at a COVID-19 clinic in Perth, with many wearing facemasks.
node.description: Those forced to isolate after being tested for COVID could become eligible for a new cash payment,Â  the WA government says, as it tries to shore up the state's health system ahead of the border reopening.
node.content:
["A payment will be offered\u00a0to\u00a0people who have to isolate after being tested for COVID-19, the West Australian government has announced, as it works to prepare the state for the arrival of the virus.", "In total $80 million has been set aside for the payments in today's mid-year review, although details of who will be eligible and how much they will receive are yet to be announced.", "Premier and Treasurer\u00a0Mark McGowan\u00a0is expected to provide those details when he delivers the review today.", "Other COVID-related measures include an extra $9.8 million for enhanced cleaning in schools, and $4.5 million for the State Welfare Incident Coordination Centre, which provides support to people in self-isolation or quarantine.", "In total, an extra $1.28 billion will be provided to the state's health system, as it prepares for the spread of COVID when borders reopen on February 5.", "
Hospitals under pressure as reopening looms
", "\"As we look to open our borders safely once we reach very high rates of vaccination early next year, we are sharpening our focus on readying our health system for the near future where we are living with COVID-19,\" Health Minister Roger Cook said.", "\"This additional funding is about ensuring there is capacity in the health system to both respond to the pandemic and deliver health services to Western Australians.\"", "", "
Ambulance ramping and a lack of hospital beds are among the pressures the state's health system is under.(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "Western Australia's hospitals are already under pressure, with doctors pointing to a lack of beds and staff.", "Mr Cook had previously blamed an increase in demand on what he called \"the COVID-19 experience\", including mental health and people deferring care from 2020.", "He said the extra spend would\u00a0go some way to help reduce pressure across the state.", "But Opposition health spokesperson\u00a0Libby Mettam\u00a0said the money was coming too late.", "\"It's extraordinary that we are over 21 months into the pandemic and the McGowan government are making these announcements now,\" she said.", "\"We are playing a desperate game of catch up when it comes to our COVID preparedness.\"", "
Hotel quarantine boost
", "Included in the review is an extra 270 hospital beds, which the government announced last month.", "Funding totalling $17.6 million will be spent to free up existing hospital beds, including transitioning elderly patients, and those on the National Disability Insurance Scheme, out of hospital.", "An extra $240 million has also been provided for \"hospital services to address health and mental health cost and demand pressures\", although how that will be implemented was not specified.", "", "
Additional funding has been set aside for hotel quarantine.(AAP: Richard Wainwright)
", "\"COVID-19 activities\", including hotel quarantine and the delivery of vaccines will also receive a $256 million boost.", "Other additional funding includes:", "Provision has also been made in the review for a procurement process to find an operator to \"commission, fit-out and run\" the Commonwealth-built quarantine facility in Bullsbrook.", "
Nurses' resignations spark concern
", "Ms Mettam\u00a0has also raised concerns about the number of nurses resigning from the state's health system.", "Between 1 April 2021 and 3 November 2021, 1,872 nurses ceased their employment with the state's health system, equating to about nine resignations each day.", "", "
WA Liberal MP Libby Mettam said she was especially concerned about the number of nurses resigning.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "That is up from six each day last financial year, and between four or five each day between 2016-17 and 2019-20.", "Ms Mettam said that was a concern, with the government expecting to employ 1,200\u00a0graduate nurses next year.", "\"The concern with these resignations is not just the sheer numbers, but also the experience that is being lost,\" she said.", "\"It is essential that not only our health workforce have new graduates, but it is also essential that we are able to retain our health workforce, which has the experience not only to support our new graduates, but also, importantly, to support our patients as well.\"", "But a spokesperson for Mr Cook\u00a0said despite those figures, the number of full-time equivalent (FTE) nurses had increased in the last year from 14,396 in November 2020 to 15,566 in November 2021.", "", "
Roger Cook says more nurses have been hired than have resigned this year, despite the stresses on the sytem.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "\"What it means is Health has hired more nurses than have left the system,\" he said.", "\"They are continuing to hire even more nurses to meet demand.", "\"There is always a turnover of staff in the health system, which has more than 50,000 employees.\"", "He said the government has also made a \"record investment in preparation for the transition beginning on February 5\"."]
